CAPTION FIG1.png: 'Figure 1. Three aspects of the scientific work--experiments, analyses, and interpretation are interconnected and applied in an iterative fashion. Swarmaries provide a progress status and facilitate information distillation and knowledge consolidation.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG2.png: 'Figure 2: (a) Lab set-up, with the tablet and PC and the Lab computer. (b) Notes taken during experiment set up. P6 had scanned a material sample and, unsure as to why the signal was noisy, pasted the results into OneNote.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG3.png: 'Figure 3. Example summary slide from P8, including graphs generated using Igor analysis software and observation notes.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG4.png: 'Figure 4: Usage of information artifacts from personal to collaborative work space: a graph from F4’s lab notebook (upper left), and a slide from P8’s summary document are both discussed at the meeting, annotated and pasted into the common meeting page. The table shows the types and roles of digital artifacts that shape ecology of the Lab.\n\n'
